title: I am an average student in 10th 70% and 12th 50%.What are my chances to crack CAT? - Quora

response.answer_text: Cracking CAT and your academics are not related. Your academics play their role during interviews and admissions. Different colleges give different weightages to different things. So you can probably research about the particular college you want to get into and calculate your chances. Thanks for reading.

This was the CAT 2014 notification: The candidate must hold a Bachelor’s Degree, with at least 50% marks or equivalent CGPA (45% in case of the candidates belonging to Scheduled Caste (SC), Scheduled Tribe (ST) and Persons with Disability (PWD)/Differently Able (DA) category) awarded by any of the Universities incorporated by an act of the central or state legislature in India or other educational institutions established by an act of Parliament or declared to be deemed as a University under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956, or possess an equivalent qualification recognized by the Ministry of HRD, This should make thing clear. Best of luck.
